https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The branch of isotope geochemistry focusing on radiogenic isotope systems, i.e. those where a daughter isotope is produced from the decay of a radioactive parent isotope.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia. Definition adapted from:
Banner, YL 2004, Radiogenic isotopes: systematics and applications to earth surface processes and chemical stratigraphy: Earth-Science Reviews, v. 65(3–4), p. 141–194, ISSN 0012-8252, doi:10.1016/S0012-8252(03)00086-2.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The branch of isotope geochemistry focusing on radiogenic isotope systems, i.e. those where a daughter isotope is produced from the decay of a radioactive parent isotope.
